intro: Silene italica var. suffruticulosa, commonly known as Italian catchfly, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, pink to reddish-purple flowers in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are linear and slightly hairy, often arranged alternately along the stem. This species thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed or open habitats.
